title: Dale Morton
text:
Dale Morton (born 31 October 1990) is an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays for the <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley Bulldogs</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>, as a .
He previously played for the <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity Wildcats</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and the <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">Championship</a>.
Background.
Morton was born in <a href="Pontefract">Pontefract</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire">West Yorkshire</a>, England.
Knottingley Rockware and Football.
Dale Morton played for his local club <a href="Knottingley">Knottingley</a> Rockware from the age of 13. He was spotted playing at a young age by Bradford and former Rockware hooker <a href="Wayne%20Godwin">Wayne Godwin</a>. He has also played for the Wakefield Service Area, and the Yorkshire District at Under 14s & 15s level. Morton was on scholarship with <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford</a> until <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> offered him a contract at the age of 16. Clubs such as <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> and <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> were also interested in signing Morton.
While playing for Knottingley Rockware he helped his team win many trophies such as the Castleford & District Cup 2005. It was during the final of this competition that Dale was spotted playing against <a href="Castleford%20Lock%20Lane">Castleford Lock Lane</a> by current Wakefield coach <a href="John%20Kear">John Kear</a>.
Before the age of 13, Morton played football for local Knottingley team <a href="Beal%2C%20North%20Yorkshire">Kellingley Welfare FC</a>. From the age 8 to 13 Dale was watched by professional football clubs such as <a href="Leeds%20United%20F.C.">Leeds United</a>, <a href="Huddersfield%20Town%20F.C.">Huddersfield Town</a> and <a href="Barnsley%20F.C.">Barnsley</a>. He then opted to play rugby league with school friends and from that day has been a success in the sport.
First team appearances.
His début season came in 2009's <a href="Super%20League%20XIV">Super League XIV</a> where he played 3-games, scoring one try. 
Morton made his first team début for Wakefield Trinity in a 30-24 win away to <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> in round 23, where he came on off the <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Substitutes">bench</a>.
He then made his first start in a 40-28 win away at <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a>, a game in which he scored a try while playing on the wing. He made his third appearance in a 24-10 win at home to <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the last round of the regular season.
